across the region tonight in ecuador
thousands of indigenous demonstrators
marched to the capital urging the
president to agree to demands for
economic and social support the latest
in a series of protests that have
injured dozens and disrupted the economy
amid a surge in the cost of living the
protest began last monday with a list of
10 demands including a fuel price cut
preventing for the expansion of
ecuador's oil and mining industry and
more time for small and medium-sized
farmers to pay off their debts
the president has called for dialogue
and announced plans to help vulnerable
sectors of the society
protesters have said the efforts are
insufficient
on monday the president expanded a state
of exception decree a special measure
used in times of disturbances or natural
disasters which affect public security
it was extended to six of ecuador's 24
provinces from a previous three but the
move came even as a national assembly
where lasso does not have majority
support was holding a session to try to
strike down the initial state of
exception decree
groups of indigenous protesters began
arriving in quito from across ecuador
late and sunday to take part in a march
from the south of the city shouting out
lasso out to the president as other
citizens cheered them on
ecuador security personnel were out in
force across the city where in some
areas protesters were burning tires and
blocked roads
in barbados the ministry of tourism and
international transport there lisa
cummins has suggested that singapore
airlines model be emulated to create a
regional carrier and that a private
public sector partnership be used to
fund it she said during monday's
barbados tourism marketing first visit
barbados industry forum that in the
absence of a national carrier as the
island works on building out an aviation
center of excellence a regional airline
is needed that is able to service all
caribbean destinations and then extend
its services throughout the globe
barbados today reports that cummins who
called for a high-level aviation
industry explained that singapore
airlines began servicing two countries
in asia before eventually expanding its
routes to international destinations she
said the caribbean needs new innovation
and it needs new investment to be able
to expand on its capability not just
intra-regionally but also globally
and finally tonight international news
french president emmanuel macron has
rejected a resignation offer from the
prime minister he appointed
saying instead that the government must
stay on task and act
elizabeth born was criticized by some
commentators after mr macron's coalition
lost its majority on sunday her future
looked under threat after the result
which left the president needing to
secure support from rivals he is set to
meet his political opponents for rare
talks today and tomorrow but neither
marine le pen's far right nor jean-luc's
left green alliance are keen to work
with mr macron centrist government which
is 44 seats shy of a majority and
desperately trying to avoid political
paralysis and that's your new source
evening bulletin for tonight i'm gordon
mosley reporting and encouraging you to
stay safe
